snippet: It goes against the grain to suggest that a successful retirement portfolio might need more stocks, but some advisers think stocks can often deliver better inflation-adjusted returns than bonds.
abstract: Some financial advisers are challenging old thinking and recommending that clients approaching or entering retirement consider increasing stock holdings in their retirement portfolio; studies find that retirement-age investors who understand the risks and can handle the year-to-year volatility may have a better shot at making their retirement money last by adding more stocks to their holdings.
lead_paragraph: It goes against the grain to suggest that a successful retirement portfolio might need more stocks, but some advisers think stocks can often deliver better inflation-adjusted returns than bonds.

headline.main: Why Stocks Belong in a Retirement Portfolio
headline.print_headline: Why Stocks Belong in a Retirement Portfolio
